content:
Citation management tools can be a huge time-saver when it comes to organizing and formatting your references. Here are some popular citation management tools that can help you format your references in APA style:

**1. Mendeley** (www.mendeley.com):
Mendeley is a free reference manager and academic social network. It allows you to organize your references, annotate PDFs, and collaborate with others. Mendeley has a built-in APA style, and you can easily generate in-text citations and bibliographies.

**2. Zotero** (www.zotero.org):
Zotero is a free, open-source citation manager that integrates with your browser and word processor. It has a large community-driven database of citation styles, including APA. Zotero also offers a citation style editor, so you can customize the APA style to your needs.

**3. EndNote** (endnote.com):
EndNote is a commercial citation manager that is popular among researchers. It offers a wide range of citation styles, including APA, and integrates with Microsoft Word and other word processors. EndNote has a free trial, and students can often purchase it at a discounted rate.

**4. RefWorks** (www.refworks.com):
RefWorks is a web-based citation manager that offers a free version for individuals. It supports APA style and allows you to organize your references, generate in-text citations, and create bibliographies.

**5. Citavi** (www.citavi.com):
Citavi is a citation manager that offers a free version for individuals. It supports APA style and allows you to organize your references, annotate PDFs, and collaborate with others.

**6. Papers** (papersapp.com):
Papers is a commercial citation manager that offers a free trial. It supports APA style and integrates with Microsoft Word and other word processors. Papers also offers a citation style editor, so you can customize the APA style to your needs.

**7. APA Style Central** (apastyle.apa.org):
APA Style Central is an official APA resource that offers a citation manager, grammar guide, and style guide. It's a paid service, but it's a great option if you're looking for an APA-approved citation manager.

All of these tools offer APA style templates and can help you format your references correctly. You can try out a few to see which one works best for you.

Additionally, many online libraries and academic institutions offer free access to citation management tools, so be sure to check with your library or institution to see what's available to you.
